thread.title: Facebook ready to test button that goes beyond 'like'
thread.title_full: Facebook ready to test button that goes beyond 'like'

author: The Associated Press
title: Facebook ready to test button that goes beyond 'like'
text:
gallery_overlay_open_thumbs|article-gallery-6507095|article-gallery-6507095|0 Image 1 of 1 
FILE - In this March 25, 2015, file photo, CEO Mark Zuckerberg gestures while delivering the keynote address at the Facebook F8 Developer Conference in San Francisco. Zuckerberg said Tuesday, Sept. 15, Facebook may finally be getting a button that lets you quickly express something beyond a "like." Photo: Eric Risberg, AP FILE - In this March 25, 2015, file photo, CEO Mark Zuckerberg... Facebook ready to test button that goes beyond 'like' 1 / 1 gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6507095|article-gallery-6507095|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6507095|article-gallery-6507095|0 Facebook may finally be getting a button that lets you quickly express something beyond a "like." Founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg said Tuesday that people have been asking for a "dislike" button on the social media site for years. Speaking at an event at Facebook's Menlo Park, California, headquarters that was streamed live online, Zuckerberg acknowledged that "like" isn't always appropriate for some posts — about a tragic news event, for example — when people might want to express empathy. Zuckerberg said the company, however, has veered away from making a "dislike" button, which could be used to vote down other people's posts. He said the new button is ready to be tested soon and could be rolled out broadly depending on how it does. ___ Highlights of Zuckerberg's Q&A: http://bit.ly/1W1dCam Top Stories
